intro: Tylostemon gaboonensis, commonly known as the Gaboon starling tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain small, smooth seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in dense rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
